comments:
Running an application with eclipse produces:

*** Stack trace of contained exception ***
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Nov 04, 2003 04:10:19.577
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.getTextLength(Matcher.java:758)

	at

	at
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.console.ConsoleDocumentPartitioner$3.run(ConsoleDocumentPartitioner.java:693)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1792)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1598)

	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:299)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:765)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:599)

and the gnome terminal:

Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Reason:
Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)

and this several times. 

I'm using log4j with
log4j.rootLogger=INFO, stderr
log4j.appender.stderr=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender

The first 1-2 log messages of the application are shown in the 
eclipse console view, after that the eclipse console is frozen, i.e. no further
log messages are visible in it. The application itself is still running without
throwing any exceptions.

This is a real blocker, since without a console real development is impossible!

Environment: Linux 2.4.21, XFree86 4.3.0.1, Eclipse-GTK 3.0M4, J2SDK 1.4.2, i686
450 MHz

I'm not sure, whether it is realeted to a consumer-producer thread problem, 
however I haven't seen this behavior on faster machines (e.g. P4 2.4 GHz) ...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 45215 ***
